body.contents: For anyone that follows Project Euler, they will know that you are not supposed to share your answers, but I think that is somewhat silly. If a person opts into doing something and then cheats just so they can answer a question that no one will be judging them on, really no one loses anything. Except the person that lost their time copying and pasting a few lines of text.

I quite like having the huge database of questions available to me, and I like to pick up a new language at random, and try out a feature I donâ€™t use enough while solving problems. Though, I will admit that I think whoever comes up with the questions over there really likes Haskell. Most of the answers are trivially expressed in little more than 5 lines of Haskell.
